issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
After running nodeadmin-pack-instance in a MANAGED-NOVLAN environment using a netapp SAN, I get this error.
{code}
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sat Jul 16 01:46:32 PDT 2016
nodeadmin-pack-instance --sc-host-port 10.111.5.139:8773 --all -o nc-backup/ --verbose
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

DEBUG: attempting to open qemu:///system

fields.summary: nodeadmin-pack-instance fails with empty local IQN

comments.body:
This was introduced by the commit here
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/commit/e64ed123dd0a67ff761297081dec189325be4ad8

The memory was being freed before it was duplicated and returned.
Changed how to deal with the resource leak.

[~jbreiding]: I updated my local cloud with the fixed 'nodeadmin-manage-volume-connections'.  Now I am getting the error below.

[~jbreiding] [~ccassler]: If the different error is not this issue, what ticket covers the different error? If we note that here, can we then "Approve fix for release" this one?

[~ccassler] [~lincoln.thomas] 
I think this one will be covered with EUCA-12598

Or at the very least have better error for the new problem. This is a different system and the iqn is no longer empty so this bug is fixed.
Verified, I am no longer seeing this error.
